item.title: Enum Cases Are Its Own Types in TypeScript
item.description: The other day I was adding a feature flag to a page within a React codebase. The relevant piece of code looked as follows: enum Light { string Green = 'Green', string Yellow = 'Yellow', string Red = 'Red', }; declare function getStatus(): Light; const status = getStatus(); switch (status) { case Light.Green: console.log('render view 1'); case Light.Yellow: console.log('render view 2 (with feature flag)'); case Light.Red: console.log('render view 3'); } Since I wanted to hit only one of the switch cases, specifically Light.
